channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Remember running the mile in school? The Presidential Fitness Test is coming back
item.description: The Cold War-era test was a staple of school gyms for half a century before the Obama administration replaced it. Trump says his focus on childhood fi...

item.title: ICE recruits former federal workers to join its ranks amid hiring spree
item.description: The push to rehire retired workers comes as the administration has also sought to downsize large swaths of the federal government through mass layoffs...

item.title: A pediatrician working in Gaza on how she finds the will to keep going
item.description: Dr. Seema Jilani is a pediatrician who has been providing medical care to children in Gaza.

item.title: A Former Rolling Stone Says the Met Has His Lost Guitar. The Museum Says No Way.
item.description: Representatives for Mick Taylor, the Rolling Stones’ former guitarist, said the Les Paul was stolen from him decades ago. The museum says he never own...

item.title: Putin Blames Frustration Over Ukraine Talks on ‘Inflated Expectations’
item.description: The Russian president didn’t directly respond to President Trump’s ultimatum that Moscow halt its offensive by the end of next week or face financial ...

item.title: Trump Says He Ordered Nuclear Submarines Repositioned After Threats From Medvedev
item.description: In a social media post, the president described the move as a deterrent prompted by threats by a former Russian leader. It is unclear if any submarine...

item.title: Researchers find some bird parents get 'divorced' after breeding
item.description: A new study from Oxford University finds that a common European songbird sometimes divorces its partner between breeding seasons.

item.title: A Fed governor plans to resign, giving Trump an opportunity to shape central bank.
item.description: The resignation comes as President Trump has openly pressured the central bank to lower interest rates and called for Jerome H. Powell, the chair, to ...

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's former girlfriend, transferred to a prison camp in Texas
item.description: The federal Bureau of Prisons said Friday that Maxwell had been transferred to a prison camp in Texas, but did not explain the circumstances.

item.title: SpaceX, NASA Launch Astronauts to Space Station as Clouds Stay Just Far Enough Away
item.description: After a scrubbed launch on Thursday, four astronauts lifted off from Florida and will dock at the International Space Station on Saturday.

item.title: Trump Turns to Untested Tariffs to Reorder Global Trade
item.description: President Trump has long wanted to rework world trade. The tariffs set to go into effect next week will carry out that plan.

item.title: Stock Market Posts Worst Week in Months on Renewed Economic Fears

item.title: Live Updates: After a Weak Jobs Report, Trump Fires That Agency’s Commissioner

item.title: How the Threat of Trump’s Highest Tariff Derailed an African Nation
item.description: The president backed off his call for a 50 percent tariff on Lesotho, imposing 15 percent instead. But in a country where most people live hand-to-mou...
